lines.text: Stella Maris, paralyzed from childhood, has been tenderly shielded from all the sordidness and misery of life. So she dwells serenly within a dream-world created by those who love her, unaware of sorrow, poverty, or death.
How beautiful this world is - and how good.
We were happy until she could no longer control this habit. Then the woman in her died and she became a Thing - a beastly - cruel - Thing!
Who asks to be admitted to the throne room?
Lor' luv a duck! An' me a'restin' on satink!
What if that poor creature had spoken to Stella Maris of life - as she knows it?
lines.character: Lady Eleanor Blount, aka Aunt Julia

lines.text: Why are you so unhappy, John?
I no longer pity the blind! All the ugliness of life is shut away from them.
